description: Nearly 80 million people are expected to travel by car, plane and train for Thanksgiving, according to AAA, thanks to lower gas prices and demand for other modes of travel like cruises.
title: Record number of people expected to travel for Thanksgiving

description: Pope Francis has called for an investigation to determine if Israel's military attacks on Gaza constitute genocide. It's the first time he's publicly suggested that Israel may be engaged in genocide.
title: Pope calls for investigation into whether Israel's actions constitute genocide

description: In an effort to address child safety concerns, digital gaming platform Roblox announced Monday that it is rolling out a major update to its safety features and parental controls.
title: With new safety update, Roblox aims to boost protection for young gamers

description: Ukraine is granted permission from the Biden administration to fire U.S.-made long range missiles into Russian territory. We hear from two NPR correspondents about this major policy shift by the White House. Our Pentagon correspondent tells us the goals around the move and what it might mean on the battlefield. And our correspondent in Moscow gives us the Russian Government's reaction to the move.
title: Ukraine is Allowed to Fire US-made Missiles into Russia

description: The Pennsylvania Supreme Court has directed county officials not to count mail ballots for the general election that arrived on time but in envelopes without current dates handwritten by voters.
title: A Pennsylvania court says again misdated mail ballots don't count this year

description: The largest chunk of funding — about $40 billion — would be for FEMA's disaster relief fund, so that it has enough money to last through the coming year. But there are requests for 16 agencies.
title: Biden asks Congress for about $100 million in disaster relief funding

description: After Timothée Chalamet showed up at his own celebrity lookalike contest, similar events have popped up in cities across and beyond the U.S. Here's a look at the winners — and what's behind the trend.
title: From Chalamet to Styles: Why are celebrity lookalike contests suddenly everywhere?

description: Spirit Airlines says it will continue flying as it files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection. Monday's announcement follows years of losses and a failed merger attempt for the low-cost carrier.
title: Spirit Airlines files for bankruptcy protection but plans to keep flying

description: Why President Biden changed his stance on Ukraine using U.S. long-range missiles to strike inside Russia. And, experts are skeptical of President-elect Trump's plan to crack down on fentanyl.
title: U.S. allows Ukraine to use long-range weapons in Russia. And, Trump's fentanyl plan

description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to America First Policy Institute spokesman Marc Lotter about President-elect Trump's Cabinet picks and policies. The group has been advising the incoming administration.
title: Trump cabinet picks offer 'fresh set of eyes,' says America First Policy spokesman

description: Members of the North Fork Community Choir in Paonia, Colo., aim to set aside their opinions on big topics when they sing. When differences arise, they figure out creative solutions to stay in harmony.
title: They disagree about a lot, but these singers figure out how to stay in harmony

description: The patient was traveling from East Africa, where the mpox disease is endemic. The CDC says the strain does not present a high risk to the general population.
title: A more severe strain of mpox has been detected in the U.S. for the first time

description: SpaceX and Amazon are asking the Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals to find the National Labor Relations Board unconstitutional. The federal agency is tasked with enforcing workers' right to organize.
title: Accused of violating worker rights, SpaceX and Amazon go after labor board

description: We have a lot of labels for Leonardo da Vinci but a new documentary seeks to understand him as a person.
title: Artist, scientist, polymath — a new documentary uncovers the real Leonardo da Vinci

description: In the 2015 Paris Agreement, most countries agreed to try hard to limit global warming to below 1.5 degrees Celsius. Delay and inaction mean that goal is becoming harder to achieve by the day.
title: Countries agreed to try to hold global warming to 1.5 degrees Celsius. Is that still possible?

description: If you've got a fever, cough, aches and pains, and you're wondering, 'what virus got me this time?" Now  you can find out, without taking a trip to the doctor.
title: Is it the flu or is it COVID? One at-home test can tell you

description: Philadelphia has disputed a state ruling that it should not have spent money from opioid-related legal settlements on home repairs and small businesses in an area ravaged by the drug epidemic.
title: Philadelphia criticized for how it's spending millions from opioid lawsuits

description: Emma Carlson Berne was at a restaurant, feeling overwhelmed with her three young children. Then a stranger came over with words she's never forgotten: "What a beautiful family."
title: 'You're doing such a good job': A stranger tells a mom just what she needs to hear

description: Two people were killed and 10 others were wounded in two separate shootings along a New Orleans parade route and celebration attended by thousands on Sunday, authorities said. There were no immediate arrests.
title: 2 killed, 10 wounded in shootings near New Orleans parade route
